item.title: 加密货币与金融体系其他部分的联系
item.description: 近年来，加密货币市场飙升，部分原因是特朗普政府支持加密货币的立场鼓励金融机构更广泛地接受加密货币。【原文：Cryptocurrency markets have surged in recent years, in part fuelled by the Trump administration's pro-crypto stance which has encouraged wider acceptance among financial institutions.】

item.title: 美国机构在 UPS 货机致命坠毁事故中发现疲劳裂纹证据
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会（National Transportation Safety Board）周四表示，在11月4日于肯塔基州路易斯维尔市造成14人死亡的失事的UPS MD-11货机的一个关键部件上发现了疲劳裂纹的证据。【原文：The National Transportation Safety Board said on Thursday it has found evidence of fatigue cracks in a key part of a crashed UPS MD-11 cargo jet that killed 14 people in Louisville, Kentucky, on November 4.】

item.title: 蓝色起源公司推出更大的 "新格伦 "火箭变体计划，与太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）一较高下
item.description: 杰夫-贝索斯（Jeff Bezos）的太空公司蓝色起源（Blue Origin）周四表示，将为其 "新格伦"（New Glenn）火箭制造一个更大、更强大的变体，为轨道卫星发射器系列制定早期计划，类似于埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）主导的太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）的猎鹰火箭舰队。【原文：Jeff Bezos' space company Blue Origin on Thursday said it will build a bigger, more powerful variant of its New Glenn rocket, drawing early plans for a family of orbital satellite launchers akin to the fleet of Falcon rockets from Elon Musk's dominant SpaceX.】

item.title: 科技日益受到关注，大型企业纷纷转战纳斯达克上市
item.description: 沃尔玛周四表示，它将把长期在纽约证券交易所上市的公司转到纳斯达克，加入这个技术密集型交易所，成为其最有价值的成员之一。【原文：Walmart said on Thursday it would move its longtime listing on the New York Stock Exchange to Nasdaq, joining the tech-heavy exchange as one of its most valuable members.】

item.title: 高盛预计下周将出现 400 亿美元的股票抛售潮
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）在路透社看到的一份给客户的说明中说，S&P 500 指数跌破了人们密切关注的水平，这给那些按趋势交易股票的对冲基金开了绿灯，它们可能在下周抛售近 400 亿美元的股票。【原文：The S&P 500 index's fall below a closely watched level gave hedge funds that trade stocks on trends the green light to potentially sell almost $40 billion in equities in the coming week, Goldman Sachs said in a note to clients seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 中国永泰称必须恢复对 Nexperia 的控制权
item.description: 在荷兰政府暂停查封这家处于全球供应链危机中心的芯片制造商一天后，中国闻泰科技公司周四表示，必须恢复对荷兰 Nexperia 公司的控制。【原文：China's Wingtech said on Thursday that its control over Netherlands-based Nexperia must be restored, a day after the Dutch government suspended its seizure of the chipmaker that has been at the centre of a global supply chain crisis.】

item.title: 美联储库克认为存在 "资产价格过度下跌 "的风险
item.description: 美联储理事丽莎-库克（Lisa Cook）周四表示，股票、公司债券、住房和杠杆贷款市场的历史性高价可能预示着估值的大幅回落，但她同时预测，任何这种回落都不太可能使整个金融体系陷入螺旋式下滑。【原文：Historically elevated prices in equities, corporate bonds, housing and leveraged loan markets may portend a large pullback in valuations, Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook said on Thursday, even as she predicted that any such drop is unlikely to send the whole financial system into a downward spiral.】

item.title: 美国联邦通信委员会投票决定推进无线频谱拍卖，避免航空业陷入僵局
item.description: 美国联邦通信委员会周四以 3-0 的票数通过了推进拍卖对先进技术用途至关重要的关键无线频谱的计划，旨在避免航空公司和电信公司之间的再次对抗。【原文：The Federal Communications Commission voted 3-0 on Thursday to advance plans to auction key wireless spectrum crucial for advanced technology uses and aims to head off another confrontation between airlines and telecom companies.】

item.title: 星巴克必须面对股东对销售额意外下滑的诉讼
item.description: 星巴克必须面对一项诉讼，该诉讼声称星巴克隐瞒了其最大市场美国和中国销售额的下降，从而欺骗了股东，导致其股价在该咖啡连锁店披露意外疲软后下跌了 16%。【原文：Starbucks must face a lawsuit claiming it defrauded shareholders by concealing declining sales in the United States and China, its largest markets, leading to a 16% drop in its stock price after the coffee chain revealed the unexpected weakness.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，软银将向俄亥俄州工厂投资 30 亿美元，用于建设 OpenAI 数据中心
item.description: 据 The Information 周四报道，软银计划投资多达 30 亿美元，对俄亥俄州洛兹敦的一家电动汽车工厂进行大修，该工厂改造后将为 OpenAI 即将建立的数据中心生产设备。【原文：SoftBank plans to invest up to $3 billion to overhaul an electric vehicle facility in Lordstown, Ohio, which will produce equipment for OpenAI’s forthcoming data centers after being remodeled, The Information reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮为美国市场带来新风险，也为并购带来更多资金
item.description: 两位顶级金融高管警告说，人工智能的蓬勃发展正在给金融市场带来新的风险，因为投资者会涌向科技股，高管们也会支付高昂的溢价来购买他们无法自行开发的人工智能技术。【原文：The AI boom is bringing new risks to the financial markets as investors flock to tech stocks and executives pay steep premiums to buy AI technology they can't build in-house, warned two top finance executives.】

item.title: 英国反欺诈办公室调查 2800 万美元加密货币崩盘事件
item.description: 在两名男子因涉嫌欺诈和洗钱被捕后，英国严重欺诈办公室周四表示，它正在调查一项价值 2800 万美元的加密货币计划的失败，并敦促投资者挺身而出。【原文：The UK's Serious Fraud Office said on Thursday it was investigating the collapse of a $28 million cryptocurrency scheme, urging investors to step forward after two men were arrested on suspicion of fraud and money laundering.】

item.title: 克罗格将目光投向 Instacart，Ocado 的机器人未来面临威胁
item.description: 美国零售商克罗格（Kroger）决定关闭与 Ocado 合作建立的八个自动化仓库中的三个，并扩大与 Instacart 和 DoorDash 等公司的合作关系，这凸显了这家英国公司面临的来自快速配送公司的挑战。【原文：U.S. retailer Kroger's decision to close three of the eight automated warehouses it built with Ocado and expand its ties with the likes of Instacart and DoorDash highlights the challenge the British firm faces from rapid delivery firms.】

item.title: 美国 10 月成屋销售增长
item.description: 尽管失业率上升和房价居高不下仍然制约着房地产市场，但由于购房者利用了较低的抵押贷款利率，10 月份美国现房销售量有所增加。【原文：U.S. existing home sales increased in October as buyers took advantage of lower mortgage rates, though rising unemployment and high home prices remain a constraint for the housing market.】

item.title: 交易员认为美联储有望跳过 12 月降息
item.description: 交易员们周四押注，美联储将在 12 月份继续按兵不动，因为政府数据显示 9 月份劳动力市场依然低迷，但并未恶化到可以支持美国连续第三次降息的程度。【原文：The Federal Reserve will keep its policy rate on hold in December, traders bet on Thursday, after government data showed the labor market remained sluggish in September but was not deteriorating in a way that would bolster arguments for a third straight U.S. rate cut.】

item.title: 即时观点9 月份就业增长加速，失业率上升
item.description: 9 月份美国就业增长速度加快，超过预期，失业率上升，表明劳动力市场依然疲软，而美联储不太可能在 12 月份降息的预期基本保持不变。【原文：The pace of U.S. job growth accelerated more than expected in September, and the unemployment rate increased, indicating the labor market remained on the sluggish side, while expectations the Federal Reserve was unlikely to cut rates in December remained largely unchanged.】

item.title: 特朗普的大额法案将促进经济增长，但美联储利率的影响会减弱 - 研究
item.description: 一位前美联储高级研究员在一份新的分析报告中得出结论，特朗普政府的巨额财政立法将促进明年的经济增长，但美联储利率保持在高于预期水平将部分削弱这一影响。【原文：The Trump administration's mammoth fiscal legislation will boost economic growth next year, but the impact will be partially undercut by Federal Reserve interest rates kept higher than they would be otherwise, a former top Fed researcher concluded in a new analysis.】

item.title: Waymo将进军明尼阿波利斯、坦帕和新奥尔良，扩大美国机器人出租车的覆盖范围
item.description: Alphabet 旗下打车服务提供商 Waymo 周四表示，将在未来几天内把机器人出租车业务扩展到明尼阿波利斯、坦帕和新奥尔良，加速在美国广泛推广其服务。【原文：Alphabet's Waymo will expand its robotaxi operations to Minneapolis, Tampa and New Orleans in the coming days, the ride-hailing service provider said on Thursday, as it accelerates the broad rollout of its services in the U.S.】

item.title: 上市大战：沃尔玛转战纳斯达克标志着战胜纽交所的政变
item.description: 纳斯达克最近的 "新宠 "是 "老牌经济"--消费巨头沃尔玛（Walmart）。【原文：The Nasdaq's latest get is about as "old economy" as it gets - consumer giant Walmart .】

item.title: 英伟达的解脱不足以消除科技泡沫的忧虑
item.description: 市场可能已经经受住了英伟达（Nvidia）关键财报的考验，但由于高估值的持续存在，大型科技公司在一瞬间改变整个市场情绪的能力将继续困扰投资者。【原文：Markets may have weathered a key Nvidia earnings test but the ability of big tech to move sentiment across markets on a dime will continue to preoccupy investors as lofty valuations persist.】

item.title: 美联储主席哈马克警告：更多降息措施将带来金融稳定风险
item.description: 克利夫兰联邦储备银行行长贝丝-哈马克（Beth Hammack）周四警告说，现在进一步降息会给经济带来广泛的风险。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Beth Hammack warned Thursday that cutting rates further right now carries a wide range of risks for the economy.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降；持续申请失业救济人数增加
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数有所下降，但在招聘疲软的情况下，更多的失业者正在努力寻找新的机会。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell last week, but more out of work people are struggling to find new opportunities amid weak hiring.】

item.title: Uber 与 Starship 科技公司合作在英国推出机器人送货服务
item.description: 优步（Uber）周四表示，该公司将与Starship Technologies公司合作，于12月在英国推出自动机器人送货服务，并计划明年扩展到其他欧洲市场，2027年扩展到美国。【原文：Uber will partner with Starship Technologies to launch autonomous robot deliveries in the UK in December, with plans to expand to additional European markets next year and the U.S. in 2027, the ride-hailing firm said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国 9 月份就业增长超出预期
item.description: 9 月份，美国就业增长加速，但失业率上升至 4.4%，经济在上个月减少了就业岗位，这表明劳动力市场状况依然低迷。【原文：U.S. job growth accelerated in September, but the unemployment rate rose to 4.4% and the economy shed jobs in the prior month, suggesting labor market conditions remained sluggish.】

item.title: 美国芯片制造商 Marvell 计划在印度大举招聘和推动研发，以利用人工智能的蓬勃发展
item.description: 美国芯片制造商美满电子科技公司（Marvell Technology）印度负责人告诉路透社，该公司计划增加在印度的招聘和研究支出，以满足全球对人工智能基础设施激增的需求。【原文：U.S. chipmaker Marvell Technology plans to boost hiring and research spending in India to tap surging global demand for AI infrastructure, its India head told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国敦促荷兰政府采取 "实际行动 "解决耐克斯佩里亚争端
item.description: 中国商务部长周四表示，中国呼吁荷兰政府采取实际行动，解决与芯片制造商 Nexperia 的争端，并帮助受影响的公司。【原文：China called for practical actions from the Dutch government to resolve a dispute over chipmaker Nexperia and to help affected companies, China's commerce minister said on Thursday.】

item.title: 调查显示，美国消费者预计将更多地使用信用卡进行假日购物
item.description: 美国征信机构全美征信公司（TransUnion）的一项调查显示，美国消费者预计在感恩节期间将更多地依赖信用卡购物。【原文：U.S. consumers expect to rely more heavily on credit cards for shopping during the Thanksgiving holiday season, according to a survey by credit bureau TransUnion.】

item.title: Verizon 在重组过程中裁员超过 13,000 人
item.description: 美国无线运营商威瑞森（Verizon）周四表示，该公司将裁员1.3万多人，这是该公司为缩减成本和重组业务而进行的最大规模裁员。【原文：U.S. wireless carrier Verizon said Thursday it will cut more than 13,000 jobs in its largest single layoff as it works to shrink costs and restructure operations.】

item.title: 争相出售日本敲响财政警钟
item.description: 投资者纷纷抛售日元和日本政府债券，使日本的借贷成本创下历史新高，使市场失去了方向，并在日本决策者试图引导经济渡过难关时给他们施加了压力。【原文：Investors bailing out of the yen and Japan's government bonds have driven borrowing costs there to record highs, bending markets out of shape and piling pressure on the country's policymakers as they try to pilot the economy through a rough patch.】

item.title: G20 监督机构告诉各国领导人，私人信贷市场和稳定币需要密切监控
item.description: 20 国集团金融风险监督机构在南非峰会前对各国领导人说，私人信贷市场和稳定币的繁荣值得密切关注。【原文：The boom in private credit markets and stablecoins warrants close monitoring, the Group of 20's financial risk watchdog told leaders ahead of their summit in South Africa.】
